meanings.definition: The arrangement of the natural and artificial physical features of an area.
meanings.sent1: The topography of the park includes hills and valleys.
meanings.sent2: Geologists use topography to understand the landscape.
meanings.sent3: The topography of the playground made it challenging for the kids to play tag.
meanings.sent4: Her face held a topography of emotions, revealing every contour of her feelings.
meanings.sent5: The topography of the forest was so diverse that each turn revealed a new wonder.

meanings.definition: The detailed mapping or description of the surface features of a region.
meanings.sent1: The topography of the map showed all the roads and rivers clearly.
meanings.sent2: Cartographers meticulously record the topography of different areas.
meanings.sent3: The topography of the treasure map led the pirates on a wild goose chase.
meanings.sent4: The topography of the painting was so intricate that every brushstroke told a story.
meanings.sent5: The topography of the city was so well-documented that getting lost was nearly impossible.

meanings.definition: The study of the surface features of a region.
meanings.sent1: In geography class, we learned about the topography of different countries.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use topography to analyze changes in the environment.
meanings.sent3: The topography of the land fascinated the young explorer, sparking a passion for discovery.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a topography of knowledge, with each fact forming a unique peak.
meanings.sent5: The topography of the desert revealed secrets hidden beneath the shifting sands.
